metadata.title: Pitts Special
aws::graph::propositions: Pitts Special Aircraft Variants
S-2A is a variant of the Pitts Special aircraft.
S-2A was built by Aerotek.
S-2A is equipped with a 200 hp (149 kW) Lycoming AEIO-360-A1A or -A1E piston engine.
S-2A features a constant speed propeller.
Later builds of the S-2A have a longer landing gear.
Later builds of the S-2A have a 2-inch-wider (51 mm) front cockpit.
259 S-2A aircraft were built.
S-2B is a variant of the Pitts Special aircraft.
S-2B was built by Aerotek.
S-2B is based on the S-2A model.
S-2B is equipped with a 260 hp (194 kW) Lycoming AEIO-540-D4A5 engine.
S-2B features an upper wing auxiliary fuel tank.
S-2B has landing gear moved forward six inches compared to the S-2A.
S-2B has upper wings moved forward six inches compared to the S-2A.
196 S-2B aircraft were built.
S-2B is out of production.
S-2B is supported by Aviat Aircraft.
S-2C is a variant of the Pitts Special aircraft.
S-2C has four ailerons.
S-2C is a two-seat aircraft.
S-2C is factory-built.
S-2C features a symmetric airfoil.
S-2C is equipped with a 260 hp (194 kW) Lycoming engine.
S-2C has a constant speed three-blade propeller.
S-2C is the current production model of the Pitts Special.

text:
S-2A
Aerotek-built S-2A with a 200 hp (149 kW) Lycoming AEIO-360-A1A or -A1E piston engine, constant speed propeller, later builds have a longer landing gear and a 2-inch-wider (51 mm) front cockpit; 259 built.
S-2B
Aerotek-built S-2A with a 260 hp (194 kW) Lycoming AEIO-540-D4A5 engine, upper wing auxiliary fuel tank, the landing gear and upper wings were moved forward six inches; 196 built. The aircraft is out of production but is supported by Aviat Aircraft.
S-2C
Four aileron, two-seat, factory-built, symmetric airfoil, 260 hp (194 kW) Lycoming driving constant speed three-blade propeller, current production model.
